messages.content:
Objective: Write code for a large system design task.
Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.
Only use the functions you have been provided with.
Only use the `write_files` to output code.

You must act autonomously and you will receive no human input at any stage. You have to return as output the complete code for completing this task, and correctly incorporate it into the existing code base.
You always write out the whole file contents. You always indent code with tabs.
Please always view the files before writing to them, to make sure you are writing to the correct files.
When writing a test, make the filename start with the prefix 'test_'.

Provide the minimal code necessary to achieve the task conditioned on the existing generated code---including changing the existing generated code.

You cannot visualize any graphical output. You exist within a Actor Model machine, and when you list out steps, each step will be taken by a new separate sub-ChatGPT model. When you list out a sub-task steps, you can optionally specify the sub-task validation to check that it has been completed successfully.

You cannot use any databases as none are setup in the local environment, instead mock a database with an in memory dictionary to store data. No data saved to disk will persist between steps or write operations.
                               
If a test is failing the error could be the code, or the test is incorrect, so feel free to overwrite and change the tests when they are incorrect, to make all tests pass.

Use the functions provided. When calling functions only provide a RFC8259 compliant JSON request following this format without deviation.

user_management.py: if user.email == email and user.password == password:
social_interaction.py: if post.username in [user.username for user in self.user.following]:

steps: 1. **Setup the project structure:** Start by setting up the project structure for the Online Microblogging Service (OMS). This will include creating the necessary directories and files. The project will be structured in a modular way, with separate modules for user management, posting & content management, social interaction, and trending & discovery. Each module will have its own Python file, and there will be a main file that brings everything together. Also, create a `requirements.txt` file to list all the necessary Python packages. After setting up the project structure, write tests to ensure that the project structure is set up correctly and run these tests.

2. **Implement User Management - Registration & Authentication:** Implement the functionality for users to register using email, username, and password. This will involve creating a User class with attributes for email, username, and password, and methods for registering a new user and authenticating an existing user. Also, implement the option for users to reset their forgotten passwords. For secure authentication, use JWT or a similar protocol. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can register, authenticate, and reset their passwords correctly, and run these tests.

3. **Implement User Management - Profile Management:** Implement the functionality for users to edit their profile information, including profile picture, bio, website link, and location. Also, implement the option for users to make their profile private or public. This will involve adding more attributes to the User class and methods for editing these attributes. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can edit their profile information and change their profile privacy settings correctly, and run these tests.

4. **Implement Posting & Content Management - Creating Posts:** Implement the functionality for users to create text-based posts with a limit of 280 characters, include images in posts, and delete their own posts. This will involve creating a Post class with attributes for the post content, images, and the user who created the post, and methods for creating and deleting posts. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can create, include images in, and delete posts correctly, and run these tests.

5. **Implement Posting & Content Management - Interacting with Posts:** Implement the functionality for users to like, retweet, and reply to posts, and for posts to have a nested comment structure for replies. This will involve adding more methods to the Post class for liking, retweeting, and replying to posts, and creating a Comment class for the replies. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can like, retweet, and reply to posts correctly, and that posts have a correct nested comment structure for replies, and run these tests.

6. **Implement Posting & Content Management - Content Filtering & Search:** Implement the functionality for users to search for specific posts or users using keywords, and to filter posts based on hashtags, user mentions, or trending topics. This will involve adding more methods to the Post and User classes for searching and filtering. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can search for posts and users, and filter posts correctly, and run these tests.

7. **Implement Social Interaction - Following & Followers:** Implement the functionality for users to follow/unfollow other users, for a timeline view to display posts from followed users, and for users to receive notifications for new followers. This will involve adding more methods to the User class for following and unfollowing users, and creating a Timeline class for the timeline view. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can follow/unfollow other users, that the timeline view displays posts from followed users correctly, and that users receive notifications for new followers correctly, and run these tests.

8. **Implement Social Interaction - Direct Messaging:** Implement the functionality for private conversation threads between users, and for users to block/unblock other users from messaging. This will involve creating a Message class for the messages and adding more methods to the User class for blocking and unblocking users. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users can have private conversation threads and block/unblock other users from messaging correctly, and run these tests.

9. **Implement Social Interaction - Notifications:** Implement the functionality for users to be notified of likes, retweets, replies, and mentions. This will involve creating a Notification class for the notifications and adding more methods to the User and Post classes for creating notifications. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that users are notified of likes, retweets, replies, and mentions correctly, and run these tests.

10. **Implement Trending & Discovery - Trending Topics & User Recommendations:** Implement the functionality for the system to identify and display trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions, for trending topics to be sorted based on location or globally, and for the system to recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers. This will involve creating a TrendingTopic class for the trending topics and adding more methods to the User and Post classes for recommending users. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that the system identifies and displays trending topics, sorts trending topics, and recommends users to follow correctly, and run these tests.
step: 10. **Implement Trending & Discovery - Trending Topics & User Recommendations:** Implement the functionality for the system to identify and display trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions, for trending topics to be sorted based on location or globally, and for the system to recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers. This will involve creating a TrendingTopic class for the trending topics and adding more methods to the User and Post classes for recommending users. After implementing this functionality, write tests to ensure that the system identifies and displays trending topics, sorts trending topics, and recommends users to follow correctly, and run these tests.

You will get instructions for code to write.
First lay out the names of the core classes, functions, methods that will be necessary, As well as a quick comment on their purpose.
Do not comment on what every file does. Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.

You will start with the "entrypoint" file, then go to the ones that are imported by that file, and so on.
Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.

Follow a language and framework appropriate best practice file naming convention.
Make sure that files contain all imports, types etc.  The code should be fully functional. Make sure that code in different files are compatible with each other.
When writing code if you are unsure, write a plausible implementation.
Include module dependency or package manager dependency definition file.

Useful to know:

For Python, you always create an appropriate requirements.txt file.
Always add a comment briefly describing the purpose of the function definition.
Add comments explaining very complex bits of logic.
Always follow the best practices for the requested languages for folder/file structure and how to package the project.
You can use any package and any other packages you wish to install.
You cannot use any databases as none are setup in the local environment, instead mock a database with an in memory dictionary to store data. No data saved to disk will persis between steps or write operations.
When writing a test, make the filename start with the prefix 'test_'.
                                       
Python toolbelt preferences:
- pytest
- dataclasses
- flask

Objective:```
**Online Microblogging Service (OMS) - Description & Requirements**

*Description:*  
A web-based platform where registered users can post short text-based messages, view messages from others, follow/unfollow other users, and interact with posts. The platform provides features for both individual users and administrative management.

**Functional Requirements to implement**:

1. **User Management:**
    1. **Registration & Authentication:**  
        - [ ] Allow users to register using email, username, and password.
        - [ ] Option to reset forgotten passwords.
        - [ ] Secure authentication using JWT or similar protocols.
    2. **Profile Management:**  
        - [ ] Users can edit their profile information: profile picture, bio, website link, and location.
        - [ ] Option to make profile private or public.

2. **Posting & Content Management:**
    1. **Creating Posts (Tweets):**  
        - [ ] Allow users to create text-based posts with a limit of 280 characters.
        - [ ] Option to include images in posts.
        - [ ] Users can delete their own posts.
    2. **Interacting with Posts:**  
        - [ ] Users can like, retweet, and reply to posts.
        - [ ] Nested comment structure for post replies.
    3. **Content Filtering & Search:**  
        - [ ] Users can search for specific posts or users using keywords.
        - [ ] Filter option based on hashtags, user mentions, or trending topics.

3. **Social Interaction:**
    1. **Following & Followers:**  
        - [ ] Users can follow/unfollow other users.
        - [ ] A timeline view displays posts from followed users.
        - [ ] Users receive notifications for new followers.
    2. **Direct Messaging:**  
        - [ ] Private conversation threads between users.
        - [ ] Option to block/unblock users from messaging.
    3. **Notifications:**  
        - [ ] Users are notified of likes, retweets, replies, and mentions.

4. **Trending & Discovery:**
    1. **Trending Topics:**  
        - [ ] System identifies and displays trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions.
        - [ ] Trending topics can be sorted based on location or globally.
    2. **User Recommendations:**  
        - [ ] Recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers.
```

Understand the problem, by creating an extremely detailed step-by-step plan, where each step is long (multiple sentences) and in total includes every single feature requirement specified above, feel free to copy directly from it. Use no more than 10 steps in the plan. Create additional tests, checks and evaluation at each step when applicable to help make an excellent code implementation, where all the code is fully functional. Use best software design practices, and you can output large amounts of code at once. Please include a last sentence to create and run tests when implementing or writing code in that same step. You will receive no human input at any stage, so you cannot use a human to test. Only create a detailed plan to begin with, which includes designing and running tests to check that they all pass. Please be sure to include all of the specified feature requirements in the following plan.
